Title: Analysis the acceptance of use for document management system using technology acceptance model
Source title: Proceedings of the 3rd International Conference on Informatics and Computing, ICIC 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Setianto, F., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suharjito, Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Most organizations today are beginning to shift from manual document management into a document management system (DMS), which is more reliable and efficient. Many benefits can be gained from the use of DMS such as document management become better and more efficient. However, DMS will not improve the performance of document management if it is not used appropriately. This study aims to determine the effect of perceived ease of use and perceived usefulness of the acceptance of the use of DMS. Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) used in this study to determine the acceptance of DMS usage. Samples were taken from 50 employees who have access to the DMS. Data samples are analyzed with Partial Least Square (PLS) method using SmartPLS 3.0. The results showed that acceptance of DMS depends on perceived ease of use that influence usefulness of DMS and led to the acceptance of DMS. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Document Management System; Partial Least Square; SmartPLS; Technology Acceptance Model
Index Keywords: Least squares approximations; Data sample; Document management; Document management systems; Partial least square (PLS); Perceived ease of use; Perceived usefulness; SmartPLS; Technology acceptance model; Information services
